{"step_by_step_thinking": "The inferior thyroid artery is a branch of the thyrocervical trunk. The internal thoracic artery supplies the anterior chest wall and is not related to the thyroid gland. The dorsal scapular artery supplies the muscles of the scapula and is not related to the thyroid gland. The costocervical trunk supplies the deep muscles of the neck and is not related to the thyroid gland.", "answer_choice": "B. Thyrocervical trunk"}
